meanings.definition: In a conceivable or imaginable manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke so imaginably that everyone understood her clearly.
meanings.sent2: He ran imaginably fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The cat danced imaginably on its hind legs, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room, imaginably bright.
meanings.sent5: The stars twinkled imaginably in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To the extent that can be imagined.
meanings.sent1: They imaginably the outcome of the experiment before conducting it.
meanings.sent2: I can imaginably how beautiful the garden will look in spring.
meanings.sent3: The chef imaginably whipped up a storm in the kitchen, creating a masterpiece dish.
meanings.sent4: His words imaginably painted a vivid picture in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist imaginably transformed the blank canvas into a breathtaking landscape.
